instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Solved but I have a question
threads.message:
[FONT=Calibri]Hello, I have yet another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but this one is solved. The original complaint was no power and no light on Magsafe. Board was pulled out and power rails were measured. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> was 3.5v which is normal condition. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was 12.26V which is abnormal and an indicator that the SMC not working. The <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal was checked via <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>. The reading was .735V which is abnormal and means the SMC is stuck in ?Reset? mode. Logic would dictate that since <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is created by <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> that it would be a likely suspect. However, this was not the case. The edge bonding around the SMC was removed to check the solder balls under it and I noticed slight discoloration of a few of the solder balls underneath, so I decide to reflow the SMC with flux.[/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri]After letting the board cool, I plugged in the charger and turned on the power supply. There was immediately a green/amber light on the Magsafe and fan spin. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was checked and confirmed to be 12.56V which is normal. The board was put back into the chassis and everything was plugged in and the computer was again powered up and confirmed to be working. But now I am left with the question; How does the board now turn on even though the <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal was saying the SMC was stuck in reset yet when I reflowed the SMC it now works?[/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Solved but I have a question
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> cannot generate high level on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
That is done by pull-up resistor <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR>.
Corrosion under SMC pulled down the signal...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Solved but I have a question
threads.message: Ah Ok. I see that on the Schematic. i haven't worked on a lot of these boards.
